page.title: 19PADBURY WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
page.content: Padbury Women's Institute,or the W.I. as most villagers know it, was formed in 1921 making it one of the oldest in the area, being formed within 5 years of the first British W.I.(the movement started in Canada). Padbury has always had a thriving W.I.. Jam still plays its part, members helping to run the W.I. Market in nearby Buckingham, but many other activities are undertaken. It is the W.I. who runs the village produce show, which is held in high regard by judges who come from outside the village. A garden sale is held in the summer, the proceeds from this go to provide a dinner and entertainment for 40 to 50 senior citizens in the autumn. The monthly meetings provide speakers on the widest possible range of topics, from Travelling to Russia to Walking in Cornwall. All in all it is another vital part of village life.
